Label.label: This feature allows you to display the title of the video currently playing.
Brand your player with your own logo displayed as a watermark on the video. Upload an image to a location on the web and provide the link below.
A timer that shows the video progress in minutes and seconds.
This timer is located at the left side of the scrubber
A timer that shows the video progress in minutes and seconds.
This timer is located at the right side of the scrubber
Usually shows the total duration of the media
Allow the user to select the flavor (Video quality) to watch.
This button allows users to switch to full screen mode, and back to regular mode.

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Displays play button on the video area. Usually shown when the video is loading or paused.
Displays Play or Pause buttons according to the state of the video.
Displays mute/unmute button with a vertical volume control bar.
The scrubber enables users to navigate through the video by dragging the handle. The scrubber also shows the buffering and playing progress.
Replays current video from the start.
A button on the video area that turns the sound on. Used for videos that are set to auto play - starts the video muted and allows the user to easily switch on the sound.

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Share this movie. Enables posting to social networks, sending email and grabbing of the embed code.

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Enables download of video to your computer. Note that the download button only supports downloads of single video files and does not support mix downloads - contact Kaltura Professional Services to enable download of mix content.

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Force download of a specific flavor

Launches the Uploader (Contribution Wizard). Allows users to add videos, images and audio files to the video. Enable this button only if you wish to allow uploading. Clicking on the button will invoke the javascript function 'gotoContributorWindow' with the current entry as an argument. In order to connect this javascript function with editor launching follow the community guide:
or contact Kaltura Professional Services for assistance.

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Allows users to change the thumbnail of the video. Users can play the video and click Capture at their preferred frame. (Usually used only by content administrators for CMS systems).

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Allows users to report inappropriate content. You may then review and moderate the content in the Moderation tab of the Kaltura Management Console.

CheckBox.label: During play, when mouse is on screen

Label.label: Shows subtitles and captions for this video using the PLYmedia SubPly solution. If there are no subtitles related to the video, the component will be hidden.
If you are interested in adding this value-added service to your account, please contact:
Displays captions on top of the video. Make sure that "Captions for accessibility" is not selected.
Prompt (text that appears on captions selector):
Displays captions in a dedicated area under video. Make sure that "Captions on video" is not selected.
Prompt (text that appears on captions selector):
Show a gallery of related videos to the user when the KDP is in certain states or when the user clicks on the player's on-screen 'Related Videos' button.
Choosing 'Tiles' will show three rows of results tiled across the entire video area.
Click here to see a samples page with working examples of each of these types of Related Videos galleries.
Automatic = Automatically generated by Kaltura (configurable below). This is the default option KDP will fall back to if you specify another Source and it doesn't return enough related items.

Reference Ids = The related videos are a list of Reference Ids either pre defined in a custom metadata field or passed to the Player at the application page level as a Flashvar or via the KDPs Javascript API.
Global Playlist = For all videos played with this player, use the same playlist as the source of the related videos.
Entry Id List = For each video, a list of entry ids is manually entered in a custom metadata field of type 'Entry-id List'.

If your source for related videos is 'Automatic', you can view this information regarding how Kaltura will generate the Related Videos for all videos watched using this player. Please note: in order to define which Entries will be used when Kaltura is searching for related videos, you can change the configuration in the bellow specified Playlist
If your source for related videos is 'Reference Ids', fill out these fields:
If your source for related videos is 'Global Playlist', enter the Playlist Id:
If your source for related videos is 'Entry Id List', fill out these fields:
Automatically begin playing the related videos:

Auto-play of related videos only happens after the current video has finished playing, and can happen even if you choose not to display the Related Videos gallery in the end screen. Auto-play only happens if the user did not interact with the KDP for the set number of seconds.
Which related video should be auto-played?
What to do when a Related Video gallery-item is clicked:
Allows custom action via Javascript, clicking on the button will invoke the javascript function customFunc1
Add the following code to your HTML page to integrate with this feature:
<script> function customFunc1 (entryId){ // add your custom code here... } </script>
If needed, contact Kaltura Professional Services for assistance
